sentence.Network_cn: 他走路时一瘸一拐的，那是小儿麻痹的后遗症。

sentence.Network_en: He wore leg braces after polio in childhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 他幼时得过小儿麻痹症后双腿安上了支架。

entry.def: Polio is a serious infectious disease which often makes people unable to use their legs.

example.ex: Gladys was crippled by polio at the age of 3.
example.tran: 格拉迪丝3岁时因小儿麻痹症腿瘸了。

means.word_mean: 1. an acute viral disease marked by inflammation of nerve cells of the brain stem and spinal cord

abbreviation.mean_cn: 脊髓灰质炎；小儿麻痹症

sentences.en: a live vaccine containing the polio virus

sentences.en: She was struck down by polio at the age of four.
sentences.cn: 她四岁那年因小儿麻痺症死去。

sentences.en: The polio vaccine has saved millions of lives.
